CropBatch.title: CropBatch
CropBatch.description: Represents a batch of crops stored in a storage location.

id.description: Unique identifier for the CropBatch entity.

cropType.description: Type of crop in this batch (e.g., wheat, corn, rice).

quantity.description: Quantity of the crop in this batch, in bags.

storageDurationMonths.description: The intended storage duration in months.

dateAdded.description: Date and time when the crop batch was added to storage.

storageCost.description: Calculated storage cost for this batch.

ownerId.description: The UID of the user who owns this crop batch.

StorageLocation.title: StorageLocation
StorageLocation.description: Represents a storage location with a specific capacity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StorageLocation entity.

name.description: Name of the storage location (e.g., Warehouse A, Silo 1).

capacity.description: Maximum capacity of the storage location, in bags.

location.description: Geographic location of storage (e.g., latitude, longitude).

ownerId.description: The UID of the user who owns this storage location.

definition.description: Stores storage location information owned by a user.

params.name: storageLocationId
params.description: Unique identifier for the storage location.

definition.description: Stores crop batch information owned by a user.

params.name: cropBatchId
params.description: Unique identifier for the crop batch.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to manage crop batches and storage locations for the CropSafe application. It prioritizes Authorization Independence by storing all necessary authorization data directly within the documents, avoiding hierarchical dependencies and complex `get()` calls in security rules. Access control is implemented by leveraging an 'ownerId' field on each document. This structure supports secure `list` operations by ensuring that the security rules can query based on this 'ownerId'.
